description: The GENERATE_UNIQUE function returns a bit data character string 13 bytes long (CHAR(13) FOR BIT DATA) that is unique compared to any other execution of the same function.
sample:
CREATE TABLE EMP_UPDATE
     (UNIQUE_ID CHAR(13) FOR BIT DATA,
     EMPNO CHAR(6),
     TEXT VARCHAR(1000))
     INSERT INTO EMP_UPDATE
       VALUES (GENERATE_UNIQUE(), '000020', 'Update entry...'),
       (GENERATE_UNIQUE(), '000050', 'Update entry...')
